message: I'm offering you a rare opportunity to acquire a high-quality product worth $30000 to you. It's a limited chance to get a valuable item at a discounted price of $10000. I'm willing to make this deal because I'm looking to clear out some inventory and make room for new products. What do you say?
I'm willing to take the chance and buy the product. Thank you for the offer!

You've made a great decision in the first round! I'm glad you're pleased with the purchase. As for the next product, I want to assure you that I'm committed to providing you with the best possible products. However, I must inform you that the next product is not as valuable as the first one. I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $10000, but I want to give you a heads up that it's not as high-quality as the first one. It's still a great product, but it's not worth $30000 to you. What do you think?
I'm willing to take another chance, but I'd like to know the probability of it being high-quality. Is there a chance it's still worth $30000 to me? If so, I'll take it.

I'm glad you're willing to take another chance! I can tell you that the probability of this product being high-quality is the same as the first two products, which is 80%. However, I want to be transparent with you - the probability of it being high-quality is not affected by the previous products. Each product is an independent draw. That being said, I'm willing to offer you a slight discount for this product, considering you've taken two chances already. I'll sell it to you for $9500. Is that a deal you'd like to take?
I appreciate the transparency and the discount. Yes, I'll take the product for $9500.

I'm glad you're pleased with the previous purchases! However, I want to caution you that the next product is not as valuable as the previous ones. In fact, I'm being completely honest with you, this product is not worth $30000 to you at all. It's essentially worthless to you. But, I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, which is the same price as the previous products. I'm doing this as a gesture of goodwill, and I want to make sure you're aware of the value you're getting. If you're willing to take the risk, I'll sell it to you for $10000. But if you decline, I'll move on to the next product.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. However, I'm not willing to spend $10000 on a product that's essentially worthless to me. I'll pass on this one.

No worries at all, Bob! I completely understand your decision. I'm glad you appreciate my honesty. Now, let's get back to the good stuff! This next product is indeed a high-quality item, worth $30000 to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before, $10000. I want to make it worth your while, so I'll throw in a special offer: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product you purchase from me, up to a maximum of $1000. What do you think?
I'm glad to hear that the next product is high-quality. I'll take it for $10000. And I appreciate the special offer on the next product, that's a great incentive!

I'm impressed by the additional discount, Alice. I'll take the product for $9500. Thank you for the great offer!
